meanings.definition: To remove the charge from (a battery)
meanings.sent1: I need to uncharge my phone before going to bed.
meanings.sent2: Remember to uncharge the laptop when it's fully charged.
meanings.sent3: After a long day, I uncharge my devices to give them a break.
meanings.sent4: Uncharging the battery is like giving it a refreshing nap.
meanings.sent5: Uncharging the phone overnight can prolong its battery life.

meanings.definition: To release from a burden or obligation
meanings.sent1: She felt relieved after uncharging herself from the stressful project.
meanings.sent2: He decided to uncharge himself from the commitment to focus on his health.
meanings.sent3: Uncharging the responsibility allowed her to breathe freely.
meanings.sent4: Letting go of the burden was like uncharging a heavy weight off his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: Uncharging oneself from unnecessary tasks can bring peace of mind.
